content.description: Climb the moderate hand crack that moves right of the roof. When the hand crack ends, move left for an easy top out and walk off (to the right). Good feet, good jams, good gear. We rapped it first and gave it a once-over, but there are a few loose bits of rock in the crack.
content.protection: Hand-sized cams. I believe I placed a #0.5, #0.75, #2 x2 , #3 x2 (BD C4s). No chains or bolts, walk off right.
content.location: About as far down exit gorge as you can get look for a prominent roof and a hand crack that runs up and to the right around the roof.

content.description: The crux is a couple bolts off the upper ledge. Stay left after the crux on the arete.
content.location: This is the first route in the Exit Gorge and at the left end/east.

content.description: First crux is passing the third bolt; second crux is frictiony face up high. Much easier if you stay on the bolt line up high.
Climb thin crack and face to ledge about 40' above, same as Electra Glide. Rest and fire the steep thin crack on the right wall.
content.location: Starts as for Electra Glide; just left of Slappy Sloper bolts.

content.description: Coming over the lower roof felt hard to me. Look for easiest way up at top or take the Bingham variation (the hard way).
content.protection: standard rack, no bolts. Slung horn for anchor.
content.location: Right of Nefertiti, about 50' away is a 4th class approach to top of wall. Right of this blocky face is a left facing dihedral with a crack system near the arete. Climb a couple of roofs and easy finish to the horn on the summit. Walk off or rappel the slung block.

content.description: Begin on left side of 15' pillar about 50 yards right of Horn Crack; follow crack to ledge and rest before tackling crux overhung shallow chimney (crux).  Easy climbing to the top.
content.protection: Protection is good but tricky. A chockstone (you can wrap a sling around it) protects the crux. A #3 is best just past crux in overhead pocket in the chimney.
content.location: Fifty yards or so right of the Horn crack are two wide cracks. This is the right one; look for pine tree at top.

content.description: A thin easy crack, just right of El Patron's chimney. Hard part is the start. After the big ledge, stay in the wide and stem your way to the mussy hooks.
content.protection: Standard rack, maybe a wide piece. Mussy hooks anchor.
content.location: Walk about 75 yards right of Horn crack to path heading up to base of route. Just right of El Patron's chimney about 20' and left of the bolts for Slappy Sloper.

content.description: A line that begins wide and narrows to a seam at the summit. The is just left of the rappel and the wide 5.9. Approach base of chimney and squirm around the big flake to easier climbing above. You can easily pass the overhung stuff above on big face holds.
content.protection: standard rack to #4 camalot, bolt anchor/no chains. Walk west to mussy hooks about 30 feet.
content.location: About 30' right of Frogleg Squimney is a continuous crack starts out as a chimney and tapers to a seam.

content.description: Start right of a left facing dihedral (actually a giant flake) and left of Frog Leg Squimney about 50' at a thin crack. Gain a ledge @ 15' up and start the main crack that quickly becomes wide. Face holds abound just make sure to look outside the crack.
content.location: Walk westerly along base of wall, past the Horn, and look for two wide cracks; this is the left one.

content.description: Steep start and easy moves past it to the meat. Pass roof and keep squeezing to make the anchors.
content.location: Right of Electra Glide's thin crack is a steep face with a small roof above. Crux moves and hard climbing get er done.

content.description: Exit Gorge is very close to the car. Only 3 sport routes here and several trad lines. After you pass the gate, continue due south to the start of the Exit Gorge (only top is visible as you approach). Nefertiti is at the start of this gorge.
